title: Hobbit
description: The Hobbit, or There and Back Again is a children's fantasy novel by the English author J. R. R. Tolkien. It was published in 1937 to wide critical acclaim, being nominated for the Carnegie Medal and awarded a prize from the New York Herald Tribune for best juvenile fiction.

title: The Silmarillion
description: The Silmarillion is a collection of mythopoeic stories by the English writer J. R. R. Tolkien. Edited and published posthumously by his son Christopher Tolkien in 1977, it is a foundational work of the Middle-earth legendarium.

title: Unfinished Tales
description: Unfinished Tales is a collection of stories by J.R.R. Tolkien, edited by his son Christopher Tolkien and published posthumously in 1980. It expands on Middle-earth’s history, providing background details for The Lord of the Rings and The Silmarillion.

title: Wyrd Sisters
description: Wyrd Sisters is Terry Pratchett's sixth Discworld novel, published in 1988. It re-introduces Granny Weatherwax of Equal Rites.

title: Reaper Man
description: Reaper Man is a fantasy novel by British writer Terry Pratchett. Published in 1991, it is the 11th Discworld novel and the second to focus on Death. The title is a reference to Alex Cox's movie Repo Man.

title: Guards! Guards!
description: Guards! Guards! is the eighth Discworld novel by Terry Pratchett, published in 1989. It is the first book in the City Watch subseries and introduces characters such as Sam Vimes and Carrot Ironfoundersson.

title: Mort
description: Mort is the fourth Discworld novel by Terry Pratchett, published in 1987. It follows the story of a young man named Mort who becomes Death’s apprentice and struggles with his new responsibilities.
